thread.title: Minnesota High School Basketball Player Nails One-Handed Pirouette Buzzer-Beater
thread.title_full: Minnesota High School Basketball Player Nails One-Handed Pirouette Buzzer-Beater

author: Patrick Redford
title: Minnesota High School Basketball Player Nails One-Handed Pirouette Buzzer-Beater
text:
Go to permalink 
Champlin Park High School came into the opening game of the Minnesota state tournament undefeated, and they left undefeated, thanks to a last-gasp buzzer-beater from senior guard Sam Dubois. The Rebels came back from an eight-point halftime hole with the help of 30 points from McKinley Wright, who missed a runner at the end before Dubois put Chaska to rest. Dubois was immediately dogpiled upon right in front of the Chaska bench. 
And some more angles:
